characteristics: Baleen whale with black, callosal skin growths on its head; slow swimmer; has a distinctive "V"-shaped blowhole; calves are born with a thick layer of blubber to protect them from the cold.
diet: Zooplankton, such as krill and copepods.
habitat: Coastal waters of the Southern Hemisphere.
usp: Southern right whales have the thickest blubber of any whale species, up to 18 inches thick!

characteristics: Large spiny lobster with a dark brown or reddish-brown exoskeleton; has two large claws and two pairs of antennae.
diet: Scavenger; eats algae, mollusks, and other crustaceans.
habitat: Rocky reefs along the east coast of South Africa.
usp: East coast rock lobsters can grow up to 15 inches long and weigh up to 20 pounds!

characteristics: Small, brightly colored fish with a long, horn-like projection on its forehead; has a slender body and large pectoral fins.
habitat: Coral reefs and rocky shores in tropical and subtropical waters.
usp: Unicorn fish are known to change color rapidly, from bright yellow to orange to red, depending on their mood and environment!

characteristics: Medium-sized, brightly colored fish with a parrot-like beak; has a stout body and large pectoral fins.
habitat: Coral reefs and rocky shores in tropical and subtropical waters.
usp: Parrotfish are known to change color as they mature. For example, juvenile parrotfish are often green or brown, while adults are often brightly colored.

characteristics: Long, slender fish with a snake-like appearance; has a large mouth and sharp teeth.
habitat: Coral reefs, rocky shores, and shipwrecks in tropical and subtropical waters.
usp: Moray eels have a second set of jaws hidden inside their throats, which they use to help them swallow prey.

characteristics: Soft-bodied mollusk with eight arms and two eyes; has a beak-like mouth and suction cups on its tentacles.
habitat: Coral reefs, rocky shores, and seagrass beds in all oceans except the Antarctic.
usp: Octopuses are highly intelligent creatures and are capable of problem-solving and learning. They are also known to use camouflage to hide from predators and prey.

characteristics: Soft-bodied mollusk with ten arms and two eyes; has a beak-like mouth and suction cups on its tentacles.
habitat: All oceans except the Antarctic.
usp: Squid are very intelligent creatures and are capable of problem-solving and learning. They are also known to use camouflage to hide from predators and prey.

characteristics: Small, fish-like creature with a long, prehensile tail; has a pouch on its abdomen where the male incubates the eggs.
habitat: Seagrass beds and kelp forests along the coast of South Africa.
usp: Knysna seahorses are some of the most monogamous animals in the world. Mates pair for life and often share the same territory.

characteristics: Long, cylindrical creature with a leathery skin; has a mouth and anus at opposite ends of its body.
habitat: All oceans except the Antarctic.
usp: Sea cucumbers have a unique defense mechanism. When threatened, they can eject their internal organs through their anus. These organs will regenerate over time.

characteristics: Large, colorful sea star with a soft, pillow-like body; has five arms and a central disk.
predators: Sea otters, seagulls, and other sea stars.
habitat: Rocky shores and kelp forests in the Pacific Ocean.
usp: Pillow sea stars are known to change color to blend in with their surroundings. They can also regenerate lost arms.

characteristics: Large, herbivorous sea turtle with a green or brown shell; has four flippers and a beak-like mouth.
diet: Seagrasses, algae, and other marine plants.
habitat: Tropical and subtropical oceans around the world.
usp: Green turtles can hold their breath for up to five hours!

characteristics: Small, freshwater fish with a striped pattern on its body; has a slender body and a forked tail.
habitat: Freshwater streams and rivers in South Asia.
usp: Zebra fish are one of the most popular fish for scientific research. They are known for their rapid reproduction and their ability to regenerate lost fins.

characteristics: Medium-sized, silvery fish with a deep, compressed body; has a small mouth and large eyes.
habitat: Coastal waters in all oceans except the Antarctic.
usp: Seabreams are known to be very social fish and often form large schools.

characteristics: Flattened, ray-shaped fish with a long tail; has a barbed stinger on its tail that can deliver a venomous sting.
habitat: Sandy bottoms in coastal waters around the world.
usp: Stingrays have a unique electrical field that they use to communicate and navigate.

characteristics: Translucent, umbrella-shaped jellyfish with four horseshoe-shaped gonads; has long, trailing tentacles.
predators: Sea turtles, fish, and other jellyfish.
habitat: Coastal waters in all oceans except the Antarctic.
usp: Moon jellies are known to bloom, sometimes in massive numbers. These blooms can have a negative impact on fisheries and other marine life.

characteristics: Large, slender shark with a long, pointed snout; has a row of serrated teeth on its upper jaw.
habitat: Deep waters in all oceans except the Arctic.
usp: Ragged tooth sharks are known to be very aggressive predators and have been known to attack humans.

characteristics: Small, brightly colored fish with venomous spines on its dorsal and pectoral fins; has a long, flowing tail.
habitat: Coral reefs and rocky shores in tropical and subtropical waters.
usp: Lionfish are known to be very intelligent fish and are capable of learning and problem-solving.

characteristics: Small, brightly colored fish with a symbiotic relationship with sea anemones; has a stout body and a long, flowing tail.
predators: Larger fish, seabirds, and sea snakes.
habitat: Coral reefs and rocky shores in tropical and subtropical waters.
usp: Clownfish are immune to the venom of the sea anemones they live in.

characteristics: Soft-bodied marine animal with a cylindrical body and a crown of tentacles; has a stinging nematocysts on its tentacles that it uses to capture prey and defend itself.
diet: Fish, crustaceans, and other marine invertebrates.
habitat: Rocky shores, coral reefs, and seagrass beds in all oceans except the Antarctic.
usp: Sea anemones are known to have symbiotic relationships with many other marine animals, including clownfish, crabs, and algae.

characteristics: Sessile marine animal with a porous body; has a skeleton made of spicules or spongin.
diet: Plankton and other small organisms that filter through the pores of its body.
habitat: Rocky shores, coral reefs, and seagrass beds in all oceans except the Antarctic.
usp: Sea sponges are one of the oldest forms of life on Earth, with fossils dating back over 500 million years.

characteristics: Soft-bodied cephalopod with a flattened body and eight arms; has a beak-like mouth and two eyes.
habitat: Coastal waters in all oceans except the Antarctic.
usp: Cuttlefish are known for their ability to change color and pattern to camouflage themselves from predators and prey. They are also very intelligent creatures and are capable of problem-solving and learning.

characteristics: Slender shark with a distinctive zebra-like pattern on its body; has a small mouth and large eyes.
habitat: Shallow coastal waters in tropical and subtropical oceans.
usp: Zebra sharks are known to be very docile and are often approached by divers and snorkelers.

characteristics: Medium-sized, brightly colored fish with a deep, compressed body; has a large mouth and sharp teeth.
habitat: Coral reefs, rocky shores, and seagrass beds in tropical and subtropical waters.
usp: Snappers are known to be very social fish and often form large schools.

characteristics: Small, slender shark with black tips on its fins; has a small mouth and large eyes.
habitat: Coral reefs and rocky shores in tropical and subtropical oceans.
usp: Black tip reef sharks are known to be very curious and are often seen approaching divers and snorkelers.

characteristics: Small, bottom-dwelling shark with thick, parallel, black stripes running along its back and sides; has a short head and snout with small nasal barbels.
habitat: Coastal waters in South Africa.
usp: Pyjama sharks are known to be very docile and are often approached by divers and snorkelers.

characteristics: Large, silvery fish with a deep, compressed body; has a small mouth and large eyes.
habitat: Coastal waters in South Africa.
usp: Galjoen are known to be very good swimmers and can reach speeds of up to 30 miles per hour.
